item.description:
This is a weekly event hosted by Bob at Laurie's. 

Please join the Red Sox Natives, Wakefield Weeknights, Boston Happy Hour and others to welcome another Morgan White Jr. (from WBZ Radio) Trivia Night at Laurie's 909 Steakhouse and Raw Bar with $1.00 Oyster Night. This is a one-of-a-kind trivia event!

Morgan is the undisputed Master of the Trivia Universe. After 30 years he continues to amaze folks with his one-of-a kind trivia show at which you provide categories and he uses his mind-boggling breadth of knowledge to create questions on the spot for your chance at prizes. Along with being smart Morgan is personable and exudes a geeky coolness. The game format is very simple, the first table to answer three questions correctly in a round wins a prize. There isn't any need to figure out a team name, submit answer sheets nor calculate team scores...it's easy breezy as well as highly entertaining. 

For more information on Mr. White http://www.morganwhitejr.com

Trivia begins at 7:00 p.m. and ends by 9:09 p.m. 

Get there when you can and stay as long as you are able.

You are more than welcome to show up for the trivia or just the camaraderie.

Have a cocktail or two or three and order the $1.00 Oysters, an appetizer or dinner from Laurie's the full menu.

All categories are welcome by Morgan for questions.

Will there be Beatles categories at this event and why?

Bring your Red Sox, Baseball and sports category trivia questions too.

If this will be your first time meeting the Red Sox Natives Crew check out the photos of those who RSVP Yes so you can find the group. 

Please remember to maintain your own tab or pay as you order and tip your servers. However, if you sit at a group table a group bill may be provided so please communicate with your server when ordering.

Laurie's 909 Steakhouse and Raw Bar is Wakefield's newest restaurant and Bar with live entertainment several nights per week. Laurie's is located at the Wakefield Commuter Rail Train Station in Wakefield. The Reading and Haverhill Commuter Rail trains stop at Laurie's. Laurie's is easily accessible within 10 minutes from Routes 128, 93, 28 and 1. Free parking is available in two lots on Tuttle Street and on street. Check out the MBTA or Hop Stop for additional public transit options.

Check out the "Penny Lane" Bar and find out about the 9:09 and Beatles references.  

More information at http://www.lauries909.com

See you there!
item.how_to_find_us: Ask Bob or the bartenders for us Seated at the Penny Lane or Raw Bar
item.name: Trivia with Morgan White Jr. & $1.00 Oysters at Laurie's 909 Steakhouse/Raw Bar
